abstract.text: Resigns the current player from the match without ending the match.

inlineContent.text: Use the
method instead.

inlineContent.text: The end outcome of the current player in the match. Do not pass
as an argument.
The next player in the match who needs to take an action. It must be one of the object’s stored in the match’s
property.
A serialized blob of data reflecting the game-specific state for the match.
A block to be called after the data is uploaded to the server.
The block receives the following parameters:
If an error occurred, this error object describes the error. If the operation was completed successfully, the value is
error

Your game calls this method on an instance of your game that is processing the current player’s turn, but that player has left the match. For example, the player may have willingly resigned from the match or that player may have been eliminated by the other players (based on your game’s internal logic).

When this method is called, it creates a new background task to handle the request. The method then returns control to your game. Later, when the task is complete, Game Kit calls your completion handler. The completion handler is always called on the main thread.

abstract.text: Enable players to interact with friends, compare leaderboard ranks, earn achievements, and participate in multiplayer games.
An object that encapsulates the match data for games where players take turns.
The state of a participant when they forfeit a match or when a match ends.
Ends the match while submitting all of the scores and achievements.
Updates the data stored on Game Center for the current match.
Resigns the current player from the match without ending the match.
Forfeits the match on behalf of the local player when it’s their turn.
The players that participate in a turn-based match.
A participant in a turn-based match.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
